name: GitHub Copilot
description: AI pair‑programmer that suggests entire lines or blocks of code in real‑time inside popular IDEs.
strengths: Wide language coverage (Python, JavaScript, TypeScript, Go, Ruby, Java, C#, C++)
Good for boilerplate and test scaffolding
limitations: Requires internet connection to GitHub API
Quality drops on very large files or unfamiliar frameworks
May generate insecure or non‑idiomatic code without review

name: Cursor AI
description: IDE built around an LLM assistant that can answer questions about your codebase and generate changes via natural language.
strengths: Supports natural‑language diff generation and in‑editor PRs
Good for reading and understanding existing projects
limitations: Full power available only in Cursor editor (VS Code fork)
Project indexing can be slow on very large monorepos

name: Amazon CodeWhisperer
description: Generates real‑time code recommendations and security scans, tightly integrated with AWS services and IDEs.
strengths: AWS API‑aware suggestions (S3, DynamoDB, Lambda, etc.)
Built‑in security scanning for 50+ vulnerability types
limitations: Less effective outside of AWS‑focused projects
IDE plugin features lag behind Copilot on some languages
best_for: Writing Lambda functions and IaC scripts

name: Replit Ghostwriter
description: Browser‑based AI assistant inside Replit’s online IDE for instant prototyping and deployment.
strengths: Works entirely in the browser—no local setup
Conversation memory across code and shell
best_for: Collaborative pair programming in the cloud

name: Tabnine
description: Privacy‑focused code completion that can run fully on‑prem or in the cloud.
strengths: Local model option for air‑gapped environments
limitations: Smaller model sizes reduce long‑range context understanding
best_for: Enterprise environments with strict data policies

name: Codeium
description: Free‑to‑use autocomplete that supports 70+ languages and multiple IDEs.
limitations: Feature set focused mainly on autocomplete, limited chat/refactor tools

name: Windsurf AI
description: (Hypothetical) Open‑source LLM‑powered assistant that runs locally and integrates with popular editors.
limitations: Smaller base model → less fluent suggestions
Manual setup required for GPU acceleration
best_for: Plugin hackers who enjoy tweaking models

name: Lovable Dev Companion
description: (Hypothetical) Empathy‑driven coding coach that mixes motivational feedback with code suggestions via chat.
strengths: Provides step‑by‑step explanations and learning resources
Gamified coding challenges and streak tracking
limitations: Not optimized for raw typing speed
Limited enterprise features or on‑prem support
best_for: Solo developers looking for morale boosts
